page.title: 09Boats in Aith
page.content: The Lifeboat.The Lifeboat is a Barnet class boat which has two 74 h.p.engines. It's called the 'John Francis Mcfarlane'. It was brought here because a fishing boat called the 'Ben Doran' went aground on the Ve Skerries in 1930 and the whole crew was lost. None of the small boats could do anything about it because of the weather. A Lifeboat had to come from Orkney. So the Lifeboat has been here over 50 years. There are 8 people in the crew. A new boat will be introduced next year. Other Boats. There are 25 small boats moored in Aith Voe and 14 in East Burrafirth. Some of the boats are use for setting creels for lobsters, some for line fishing and some for pleasure. A few people fish scallops. Some people have more than one boat.
